item.title: Intense fire has damaged tree and is possibly dangerous, 19th July
item.description:
A fire broke out in the hedges at the border of Sidcup Cemetary and the alleyway that separates the cemetary from Cotleigh Avenue. (Started deliberately according to the fire brigade who attended) This tree (pictured) also caught fire intensely. Its branches were so long they crossed the alley way and were growing into the bushes and trees of my property. Consequently the fire spread from the tree in the cemetary to the bushes of my property. Luckily the fire brigade were able to put out all the fires (not before the intense heat from the flames destroyed my guttering and plastic fascia’s). The tree is now very dead and looks like it could fall (which depending on where is falls would damage either my property or the graveyard_ Other trees further down the cemetary border are also overgrowing the alleyway and over my property line. Were they to catch fire, our properties would,also be at risk. Please have someone look at these trees before something more serious happens.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Penfold Lane, Albany Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car parked on pedestrian walkway, 19th July
item.description:
Parking in Blondin Way has designated bays, this car is parked on the pedestrian path, sticking out into the corner of the road which makes it harder for cars going around the corner, and fully blocks the path for pedestrians. This has been going on for at least a month.
